issues.title: Missing Administrative Regulation for Implementation Procedures
issues.description: Education Code 41030-41031 requires specific procedures for handling gifts of money, including placement in county treasury and accounting requirements. The policy references these code sections but lacks detailed implementation procedures that should be contained in an Administrative Regulation.

legal_citations.text: Requires specific procedures for receipt, accounting, and treasury placement of monetary gifts to school districts

issues.required_language: Administrative procedures detailing: (1) Process for receiving and documenting gifts; (2) Procedures for placing monetary gifts in county treasury; (3) Accounting and tracking requirements; (4) Approval workflows and authority levels; (5) Reporting procedures for annual Board reports; (6) Forms and documentation requirements

issues.title: Missing Gift Valuation and Tax Implications
issues.description: IRS regulations and California Revenue and Taxation Code require districts to properly value gifts and handle tax implications. The policy lacks procedures for gift valuation, tax documentation, and donor acknowledgment requirements for tax-deductible contributions.

legal_citations.citation: Revenue and Taxation Code 214; IRS Publication 526
legal_citations.text: Public agencies must properly document and value gifts for tax purposes and provide appropriate donor acknowledgments

issues.required_language: Procedures for: (1) Professional appraisal of non-monetary gifts over specified thresholds; (2) Issuance of tax acknowledgment letters to donors; (3) Documentation of gift fair market value; (4) Coordination with county assessor for property gifts

issues.title: Missing Conflict of Interest Safeguards
issues.description: Government Code 1090 and the Political Reform Act require public agencies to have safeguards against conflicts of interest in gift acceptance. The policy lacks procedures to ensure Board members and staff do not have financial interests in gift sources.

legal_citations.text: Public officials may not have financial interests in contracts or decisions, including gift acceptance decisions

issues.required_language: Procedures requiring: (1) Disclosure of any financial relationships between district officials and gift donors; (2) Recusal requirements when conflicts exist; (3) Review process to identify potential conflicts before gift acceptance

issues.title: Missing Reference to Uniform Complaint Procedures
issues.description: When gift acceptance decisions affect educational equity or student access, they may be subject to uniform complaint procedures under Title 5 CCR. The policy should reference this appeal mechanism.

legal_citations.text: Uniform complaint procedures apply to issues affecting educational equity and student access

issues.required_language: Reference that gift acceptance decisions affecting educational equity may be subject to the district's uniform complaint procedures

issues.title: Missing Insurance and Liability Considerations
issues.description: Acceptance of certain gifts (particularly equipment, vehicles, or property) may create insurance and liability obligations that should be evaluated before acceptance.

legal_citations.text: Districts must consider liability implications of property acceptance and ensure adequate insurance coverage

issues.required_language: Requirement to evaluate insurance and liability implications of gift acceptance, particularly for equipment, vehicles, and real property
